Event.0: NBC musical drama series "Smash" actress Debra Messing (43) divorces actor and producer Daniel Zelman (44) by their mutual decision after 10 years of marriage
Event.1: "Lost" actress Emilie de Ravin (27) divorces actor Josh Janowicz (27) after three years of marriage
Event.2: American politician Ronald Reagan—who, as the 40th president of the United States (1981–89), became known for his conservative Republicanism, his fervent anticommunism, and his appealing personal style—died in Los Angeles.
Event.3: "Nightline" presents its 1st "Town Meeting" the subject is AIDS & the show runs until 3:47 AM
Event.4: Steve Cauthen wins aboard Slip Anchor at Epsom Downs to become the only jockey to win both the Kentucky Derby (1978) and The Derby
Event.5: Indira Gandhi orders an attack on Sikh's holiest site, the Golden Temple in Amritsar
Event.6: AIDS was reported for the first time, following the detection of a rare form of pneumonia in five homosexual men in Los Angeles.
Event.7: AIDS Epidemic officially begins when US Centers for Disease Control reports on pneumonia affecting five homosexual men in Los Angeles
Event.8: World's first today in history program with editable data "TODAY", invented by Michael Butler runs for the first time on a mainframe computer
Event.9:
Neil Patrick Harris
American actor
was born
Event.10:
Mark Wahlberg
American actor and producer
was born
Event.11:
Start of the Six-Day War
Israel—amid rising tensions with Egypt, Syria, and Jordan—staged a preemptive air assault and soundly defeated those Arab countries, notably seizing the Old City of Jerusalem and the Gaza Strip before a cease-fire.
Event.12: Six-day war begins between Israel and the neighboring Arab states of Egypt, Jordan and Syria
Event.13: State of siege proclaimed in Iran, Ayatollah Khomeini arrested
Event.14: US Secretary of State George Marshall outlines the "Marshall Plan" to rebuild Western Europe
Event.15: In an address at Harvard University, U.S. Secretary of State George C. Marshall advanced the idea of the Marshall Plan, a European self-help program to be financed by the United States.
Event.16:
Laurie Anderson
American performance artist and author
was born
Event.17: Benjamin Britten's opera "Peter Grimes" premieres in London
Event.18: In World War II, Allied forces entered Rome.
Event.19: NBA coach Red Auerbach (23) weds Dorothy Lewis
Event.20: Canadian politician Joe Clark, who in 1979 became the country's youngest prime minister, was born.
Event.21: Actress Agnes Moorehead (29) weds actor Jack G. Lee (28)
Event.22:
John Maynard Keynes
British economist
was born
Event.23: English economist, journalist, and financier John Maynard Keynes, best known for his revolutionary economic theories (Keynesian economics) on the causes of prolonged unemployment, was born.
Event.24:
Pancho Villa
Mexican revolutionary
was born
Event.25: Sultan Bargash bin Said under British pressure closes the infamous slave market of Zanzibar in modern day Tanzania
Event.26: Industrialist Samuel Colt (41) weds philanthropist Elizabeth Hart Jarvis (29)
Event.27: The absolute monarchy in Denmark was abolished and replaced by a new constitution that established a constitutional monarchy with a parliament, as well as freedom of the press, religious freedom, and the right to hold meetings and form associations.
Event.28: Social philosopher and political economist Adam Smith was baptized in Kirkcaldy, Fife, Scotland.
